lines.text: Hey Johnny, what are you rebelling against?
Whadda you got?
I love you, Johnny. I've been looking in every ditch from Fresno to here hoping you was dead.
You're still fighting, aren't you. You're always fighting. Why do you hate everybody?

[as Charlie and other townsmen beat him up]
My old man used to hit harder than that.

I don't get you. I don't get your act at all, and I don't think you do either. I don't think you know what you're trying to do or how to go about it. I think you're stupid. Real stupid and real lucky. Last night you scraped by, just barely; but a man's dead on account of something you let get started even though you didn't start it.

That's better Johnny. You know I miss you. Ever since the club split up, I miss you. We all missed ya... you miss 'im? yea. The Beetles missed ya. All the Beetles missed ya. Come on Johnny, let's you and me go inside and have a beer...

[opening narration]
It begins here for me on this road. How the whole mess happened I don't know, but I know it couldn't happen again in a million years. Maybe I could of stopped it early, but once the trouble was on its way, I was just goin' with it. Mostly I remember the girl. I can't explain it - a sad chick like that, but somethin' changed in me. She got to me, but that's later anyway. This is where it begins for me right on this road.

You think you're too good for me. Nobody's too good for me! Anybody thinks they're too good for me, I make sure I knock 'em over sometime. Right now, I could slap you around to show you how good you are and tomorrow, I'm someplace else and I don't even know you or nothing.
I don't know if there's any good in you. I don't know if there's anything in you. But, I'm gonna take a big fat chance... and let you go.

[to Johnny]
What's a matter? You been hit on the head so often, you don't know when you're getting a break? At least say thank you.
[Nods to Sheriff Bleeker and Kathie]
It's alright. He doesn't know how.
[watching Johnny and Chino fight]
What are they fighting about?
Don't know. Don't know themselves, probably.
What are you someone that makes sandwiches or something?
I wish I was going someplace. I wish you were going someplace. We could go together.

I've seen hoodlums like this before. If you don't get tough with them the minute they get out of line you're sunk. You're the cop, aren't you? If you can't boot these jerks out there's plenty of us can, even if we have to bust a few heads.
Nobody tells me what to do. You keep needlin' me, if I want to, I'm gonna take this joint apart and you're not gonna know what hit you.
Well, what d'ya do? I mean, do you just ride around or do you go on some sort of a picnic or something?
A picnic? Man, you are too square. I'm... I... I'll have to straighten you out. Now, listen, you don't go any one special place. That's cornball style. You just go.
[snaps fingers]
Why are you trying to be so rude?
I don't like cops!
Where are you going when you leave here?
[he pauses and just shrugs]
Don't you know?
Oh, man. we're just gonna go!
I'm afraid of you? Are you cracked?

[referring to Johnny]
You haven't fallen for this fellow, have you?
No. No, I couldn't.
I'm sorry, I can't fight back. I'm too tired. It would be better, wouldn't it? Then you could hit me.
